alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 02 at 12:07PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR AREAS NEAR PICA, ARIZONA... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Yavapai and Coconino counties between Peach Springs and Seligman in northwest Arizona. * WHEN...Until 315 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1202 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rural areas near Pica, Arizona. - This includes Route 66 between mile markers 117 and 125. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
